body:
### Describe the bug

I am trying to build a alpine python 3.7 container with pymssql==2.1.5 and Cython==0.29.30. I have already build this image many times with success, but today (18 july 2023) it start to failed in many machines. I saw equal error in Cython==3.0.0 and even updating cython version the error persist. Someone knows why this older version crash? Have someone passed through this and knows how to solve this problem?


Collecting pymssql                                                                                    
  Downloading pymssql-2.2.7.tar.gz (170 kB)

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

_No response_

### Expected behaviour

_No response_

### OS

Linux 18.04; Docker alpine3.16

### Python version

3.7.15

### Cython version

0.29.30

### Additional context

_No response_

comment_data.body: I created this issue because I have only seen the problem to Cython==3.0.0, but resemble it happens on older versions too
This definitely looks like you're actually using Cython 3.0 even if you think you're using 0.29.x. Would it be possible to add a print for the version in setup.py to check?

@da-woods, I am using requirements.txt generated by pip freeze and with this both packages

pymssql==2.1.5
Cython==0.29.30

![image](https://github.com/cython/cython/assets/59065800/62afb5f3-04a2-4060-adf6-d81f4ce0fc9c)
It is the same file in separated screens.

I tried to make a build in Dockerfile only with these packages and still same error.
RUN pip install Cython==0.29.30
RUN pip install pymssql==2.1.5

Do you say it is Cython 3 because something in the log, or only because the error??

> Do you say it is Cython 3 because something in the log, or only because the error??

Because of the error.

Wanted to mention, that this happens inside docker of my M1 machine also. 
On intel AND m1 mac machines.

perhaps the with gil / no gil is the problem here - i try a bit 
![Screenshot by Dropbox Capture](https://github.com/cython/cython/assets/10896358/eb162fd7-8b42-4a36-bc16-296265b97453)
Just wanted to bump this by saying that I am facing the same issue currently, it is happening to me on Azure Pipelines as well as locally.

This also affects intel machines;

What i saw right now:
- pip freeze shows i am using cython 0.29.35

when i install pymssql i just saw that it is downloading the latest cython 3.0.0 version when pip installing the pymssql.

Seems if i can avoid downloading the cython 3.0.0 at install it will work again:
![Screenshot by Dropbox Capture](https://github.com/cython/cython/assets/10896358/24b4c51b-218c-42e5-bf6d-78f649596830)

(happening same on Mac M1 and Intel machine)

ok by this it works again:
![Screenshot by Dropbox Capture](https://github.com/cython/cython/assets/10896358/a25db79e-b56d-42ee-8f64-278697248450)
Setting pyproject.toml and forcing not to use latest Cython by setting it to the latest best 0.29.35 cython version.

I make a pull request and a branch.

Installing could then work with
pip3 install git+https://github.com/....@branch

When compiling the libs must be present:
![Screenshot by Dropbox Capture](https://github.com/cython/cython/assets/10896358/f4b2ee78-dcc8-4c82-a724-314bfdcb247d)
I will check out installing them on ubuntu based image and see if it also works.

In order to compile fully those libs are required on ubuntu:
```
apt-get install libcurl4-openssl-dev zlib1g-dev libkrb5-dev libssl-dev
```

I will now make a pull request to restrict the cython to 0.29.35. I hope the maintainer is merging that very soon, that this is available on pypi.

![Screenshot by Dropbox Capture](https://github.com/cython/cython/assets/10896358/16ee3107-5926-4831-9415-d54369d40467)
i branched away from 2.2.7 version - now doing pull request. please help me reach the maintainers.
I really need this pull request to go through as I depend on the package a lot currently, hopefully it won't take long

Sorry - i am old but not experienced with pull requests and open source projects:

Here is the fixed 2.7.7 version.
https://github.com/marcwimmer/pymssql/tree/fix_cython_compiler_version

I could not push to this repo here.

@capkz if you need to install now:
pip3 install git+https://github.com/marcwimmer/pymssql@fix_cython_compiler_version

Trying to make the pull request now.
Thanks a lot @marcwimmer, unfortunately on my way of working I can not install packages like that for security reasons, but I will be on lookout for the pull request to go through!

https://github.com/pymssql/pymssql/pull/827
Pull request done - lets call the maintainers somehow :) which timezone are they?

A temporary solution until @marcwimmer's solution goes live:
```
echo "Cython==0.29.35" >> constraints.txt
export PIP_CONSTRAINT="$(pwd)/constraints.txt"
```

Thanks @blink1073 for providing that link!

title: [BUG] Cython 0.29.30 failing build with pymssql
